alert.note: Alert for Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 5:23PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact Lake Powell and surrounding areas in Coconino County through 600 PM MST... At 517 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms heading towards Lake Powell from the northwest moving at 15 mph. This includes locations such as Wahweap and Page. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, lightning, and brief heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds and lightning will be hazardous to boaters on Lake Powell. The strong gusts could also blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Page, Big Five, Wahweap and Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98. This includes the following highways... State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 547 and 554. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Powell, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
